JobTitle: Senior Security Manager, RMD Self-Inspection Program
JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating.At Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD) we regard the security of our employees, its assets, tangible and intangible, to be of primary importance to our continued growth, profitability and success. The establishment of security controls and procedures is essential for the protection of employees, the preservation of assets, and the effective enforcement of rules and regulations.We are seeking a highly motivated security professional to lead the overall Self-Inspection Program for Raytheon Missiles and Defense.  This position is classified as REMOTE.  The individual will be required to come to a Raytheon Missiles and Defense location from time to time and to support onsite Self Inspections. Job Summary: The Senior Manager, RMD Self-Inspection Program will be responsible executing the long-term strategy of the RMD Self Inspection Program.  You will manage a team of experienced professionals.  You will be expected to expand upon the existing program to ensure that the RMD Self Inspection program grows with the larger organization.  This role is in Industrial Security, but will collaborate with Physical Security, CI&I, Mission Area Security, Security Business Operations and Cybersecurity to ensure that all facets of GSS are properly included.Responsibilities to Anticipate: Responsibilities include ensuring that all RMD cleared facilities have an annual self-inspection evaluating compliance with all regulatory requirements, as well as, internal policies and procedures using appropriately cleared and knowledgeable security professionals from within Raytheon Technologies Company.  Ensure that meaningful monthly Continuous Monitoring activities are conducted for all sites.  Subsequent to the self-inspections, the candidate will ensure the adequacy of the findings to ensure corrective actions that identify root cause have been implemented in accordance with government and/or company requirements.  You will also be responsible to ensure that all outstanding items are closed in a timely manner.  As a leader you will also be required to assign, manage and coordinate daily tasking and ensure proper execution.  Manages all aspects of staffing and professional development of the team. The chosen candidate ensure that the business has meaningful metrics to identify areas for improvement or increased focused.  It is expected that this individual will make significant improvements to processes and systems as this program evolves.Occasional domestic travel is required.Qualifications You Must Have:A Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Security and/or Risk Management, Government Policy, Information Management, Criminal Justice, or other related field of study is required. Other degrees may be considered.
